title: Instructional Design Based on the ADDIE Model for Medical School Admissions Process Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of higher education assessment systems and admissions processes
context.additional_context: An intensive short-term course for current practitioners to strengthen competencies in designing, implementing, and evaluating medical school selection processes. Conducting asynchronous learning via LMS in a smartphone-centric access environment

learning_goals: Apply the five phases of the ADDIE model to propose a systematic analysis and design plan for a medical school selection process.
Establishing and applying measurement criteria to evaluate the validity and fairness of selection tools
Developing an implementation plan for a selection process feasible in limited technological environments

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
